data.title: Make SpriteBatch.End throw when Begin not called
data.body:
fixes #5688 
@tomspilman

data.title: SpriteBatch.End() doesn't check for Begin()
data.body:
As per the documentation `SpriteBatch.End()` should throw an `InvalidOperationException` exception if `Begin()` has not been called.

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.spritebatch.end.aspx

Somehow this got lost in some refactor.

We need to add this check back into the codebase.

Also we need to add to our unit tests a check to ensure `SpriteBatch.Begin()` and `SpriteBatch.End()` throw the correct exceptions.

data.title: Rename Exit to Quit on Pipeline Tool Linux Headerbar
[Pipeline Tool] Use built-in Eto dialog stuff
data.body:
Stuff done:
 - Dialogs now use the integrated `Dialog<T>` method for returning result
 - Dialogs now autoposition buttons using Etos Positive / Negative buttons properties
 - Dialogs on Mac are now attached to the parent window
 - Removed some dialog per platform hacks

data.title: Improve GamePadThumbSticks code
data.body:
Stuff done:
 - Replaced constructor code with calling another constructor
 - Moved methods that were getting called just once to constructor
 - Moved constants to the top of the class

data.title: Eto Forms Update
data.body: Just a minimal change to update Eto Forms assemblies.

data.title: Remove Song absolute uri check
data.body:
This PR removes the unnecessary absolute uri check in `Song.FromUri`. 

Not sure how this was determined to be needed before, but it isn't documented to be the case.

Plus the check interferes with consoles where the path might be absolute.

data.title: XACT sound streaming
data.body:
This PR has the initial required plumbing for streaming sounds in XACT.

Platform specific streaming solutions still need to be worked out.  For now all platforms throw a `NotImplementedException` to alert the user.

data.title: Extend WritePcmFile
data.body: Added support for changing bitrate and sample rate in the internal utility method `WritePcmFile`.  Makes it a bit more flexible for use within the pipeline.

data.title: WindowsDX: Game.IsActive defaults to true on launch, even if the user is clicking or typing in another program
data.body:
The only way to have Game.IsActive update correctly is to give the game window focus and then click elsewhere. Until you focus on the game window it will always be true, which can cause issues if a player is typing in a browser, for example. 

To recreate:

- Add a `Console.Writeline(IsActive)` to Game1.Update()
- Launch a game or app, but don't click the window
- Click around / type in other applications and you'll see it continues to say `True`

data.title: The defender
data.body: Super nice game

data.title: XNA Mouse.GetState().Y Inaccurate on Multi Monitor Setup
data.body:
The Y Coordinate reported by Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Mouse.GetState() can be incorrect on multi-monitor setups. It appears that if the secondary monitor is vertically offset from the primary monitor, the Y coordinate is similarly vertically offset.

In these screenshots the application is running on a secondary, 4k monitor. The X coordinate is always correct, the Y coordinate offset is based on offset between monitors.

No vertical offset, the entity correctly tracks cursor using GetState():
![xna-coords-good](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/711100/25536916/baae1096-2bf9-11e7-9b9a-0119f64e4af9.png)

Vertical offset in monitors, the entity is similarly offset from cursor:
![xna-coords-bad](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/711100/25536935/c90d686c-2bf9-11e7-9ba0-969e6b45dad4.png)

data.title: Use GraphicsCapabilities.MaxTextureAnisotropy on SamplerState
data.body:
-Move property MaxTextureAnisotropy from GraphicsCapabilities.OpenGL.cs
to GraphicsCapabilities.cs
-Enforce MaxAnisotropy limit when we create SamplerState [DX].
GL already does something similar:
https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/7c3d6870a38f8a5e479e64d935d692f2610e1cda/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/States/SamplerState.OpenGL.cs#L72

Feature level 9.1 Max Anisotropy = 2.
Feature level 9.2 and up, Max Anisotropy = 16.

Fixes: #5674

data.title: [DX] Use GraphicsCapabilities.MaxTextureAnisotropy on SamplerState
data.body:
-Move property MaxTextureAnisotropy from GraphicsCapabilities.OpenGL.cs
to GraphicsCapabilities.cs
-Enforce MaxAnisotropy limit when we create SamplerState [DX].
GL already does something similar:
https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/7c3d6870a38f8a5e479e64d935d692f2610e1cda/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/States/SamplerState.OpenGL.cs#L72

Feature level 9.1 Max Anisotropy = 2.
Feature level 9.2 and up, Max Anisotropy = 16.

Fixes: #5674

data.title: SamplerState.AnisotropicClamp throws 'SharpDX.SharpDXException
data.body:
Setting SamplerState to AnisotropicClamp throws exception: 

```
SharpDX.SharpDXException was unhandled
  HResult=-2147024809
  Message=HRESULT: [0x80070057], Module: [General], ApiCode: [E_INVALIDARG/Invalid Arguments], Message: The parameter is incorrect.

  Source=SharpDX
  StackTrace:
       at SharpDX.Result.CheckError()
       at SharpDX.Direct3D11.Device.CreateSamplerState(SamplerStateDescription& samplerDescRef, SamplerState samplerStateOut)
       at SharpDX.Direct3D11.SamplerState..ctor(Device device, SamplerStateDescription description)
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SamplerState.GetState(GraphicsDevice device) in p:\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\States\SamplerState.DirectX.cs:line 53
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SamplerStateCollection.PlatformSetSamplers(GraphicsDevice device) in p:\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\SamplerStateCollection.DirectX.cs:line 54
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.PlatformApplyState(Boolean applyShaders) in p:\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\GraphicsDevice.DirectX.cs:line 1298
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.ApplyState(Boolean applyShaders) in p:\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\GraphicsDevice.cs:line 477
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.PlatformDrawUserPrimitives[T](PrimitiveType primitiveType, T[] vertexData, Int32 vertexOffset, VertexDeclaration vertexDeclaration, Int32 vertexCount) in p:\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\GraphicsDevice.DirectX.cs:line 1408
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.DrawUserPrimitives[T](PrimitiveType primitiveType, T[] vertexData, Int32 vertexOffset, Int32 primitiveCount, VertexDeclaration vertexDeclaration) in p:\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\GraphicsDevice.cs:line 1045
       at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.DrawUserPrimitives[T](PrimitiveType primitiveType, T[] vertexData, Int32 vertexOffset, Int32 primitiveCount) in p:\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\GraphicsDevice.cs:line 1006
```
      
Platform: Windows/DirectX
Profile: Reach
Version: latest Git source.

XNA/Reach & MG 3.5.1/Reach works just fine.

data.title: Fixed Gamepad DPad on Android
data.body: DPad was only implemented in case it was read as 4 buttons (which is rare), but was not implemented in case it was read as an axis.

data.title: Pipeline process not terminating on exit fix
data.body: Fixes #5439

data.title: Cleanup gamepad stuff
data.body:
Stuff done:
 - Added missing documentation
 - Fixed existing documentation
 - Fixed code formating
 - Merged variables with their properties where appropriate
 - Implemented missing ToString/GetHashcode methods
 - Fixed Equals method for GamePadState (it was using the default one, and for structs AFAIK it uses reflection which is slower than if you were to implement it manually)
 - Made some internal properties private and fixed up the tests that were using them... instead of the internal constructors....

data.title: Implement GetHashCode and ToString methods for Joystick
data.body: Extra thing I did was change the axis type from float to int since it should have been that in the first place.

data.title: Filter GraphicsDevice by GraphicsProfile
data.body:
Somewhere in here:

https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/GraphicsDeviceManager.cs#L291

We should be enumerating the `GraphicsAdapter`s in the system and picking the ones available based on requirements including `GraphicsAdapter.IsProfileSupported(GraphicsProfile)`.  You can see sort of how this works in the XNA docs:

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphicsdevicemanager.findbestdevice.aspx

If no supported device is found XNA seems to throw a `NoSuitableGraphicsDeviceException`:

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.nosuitablegraphicsdeviceexception.aspx

You can see it in use from `GraphicsDeviceManager.ApplyChanges()` which does the work of 

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphicsdevicemanager.applychanges.aspx

data.title: Monogame from nuget not workin with SharpDX
data.body:
I always get Type Loader Exceptions. I tried to use SharpDX wich is included in MonoGame Nuget, and also tried to use 3.1.1 SharpDX Nugets.

I need to register the SharpDX Dlls also in my Project, because I use code of them.

Maybe related to #3744

data.title: Stretching Window too far causes exception
"This MGFX effect is for an older release of MonoGame and needs to be rebuilt" exception
data.body:
So my situation is as follows:  
Code primarily on my desktop, VS2017 Community with MonoGame 3.6.0.1625. Everything builds and runs as expected.  
I am now trying to code on my laptop, Identical setup. VS2017 Community with MonoGame 3.6.0.1625. The code is pulled straight from github, compiled(With 0 errors) and then run, The exception is thrown before the game launches. The only difference is Windows version, My desktop has the creators update and my laptop doesnt. That shouldnt affect it though AFAIK.    
Any thoughts why this is happening and how I can fix it?

data.title: Remove GraphicsDevice.GetHighestSupportedGraphicsProfile()
data.body:
Platforms that use the `GraphicsDeviceManager.Legacy.cs` (GL?) will
default to Reach profile. Just like the DX platforms since 3.6.

data.title: DesktopGL resizing only updates at the end
data.body: When manually resizing a GameWindow in a DesktopGL project, the values for Window.ClientBounds.Width and Window.ClientBounds.Height are only changed when the window is done being resized. In Monogame 3.5 those values were updated throughout the resizing process.

data.title: AudioStopOptions.AsAuthored is not supported (XACT)
data.body:
When using XACT Cue.Stop(AudioStopOptions.AsAuthored) stops immediately and doesn't actually stop as authored.

I have a looping sound that has been authored to "play release" when told to stop as authored and it just kills the sound instead.

data.title: XACT crashes with a SharpDX Exception when ADPCM compression is enabled
data.body:
When using XACT with monogame I expected to not be able to use xWMA (sadly) and I can live with the massive files of ADPCM for the most part with disk streaming. But when I change from PCM to ADPCM my game crashes when trying to play a Cue. With the following exception.

```
{SharpDX.SharpDXException: HRESULT: [0x88960001], Module: [SharpDX.XAudio2], ApiCode: [XAUDIO2_E_INVALID_CALL/InvalidCall], Message: Unknown
   at SharpDX.XAudio2.XAudio2.CreateSourceVoice_(SourceVoice sourceVoiceOut, IntPtr sourceFormatRef, VoiceFlags flags, Single maxFrequencyRatio, IntPtr callbackRef, Nullable`1 sendListRef, Nullable`1 effectChainRef)
   at SharpDX.XAudio2.SourceVoice.CreateSourceVoice(XAudio2 device, WaveFormat sourceFormat, VoiceFlags flags, Single maxFrequencyRatio, IntPtr callback, EffectDescriptor[] effectDescriptors)
   at SharpDX.XAudio2.SourceVoice..ctor(XAudio2 device, WaveFormat sourceFormat, VoiceFlags flags, Single maxFrequencyRatio)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.SoundEffect.PlatformSetupInstance(SoundEffectInstance inst)}
```

My platform is UWP, running on the latest windows 10, fast ring.

I would expect this to be supported, and unlike xWMA it doesn't throw a not supported exception. So I assume it is either a bug or I am doing something wrong somehow.

data.title: Xact Marker Events are not supported
data.body:
I get a NotImplementedException("Marker event"); when I try to load a xact file with a marker set in it.

Is this planned to be implemented or does anyone have any tips on how I should start?

Does anyone have any idea of where this format is documented, or is it more of a fiddle with the bit loading until we get some data that looks right kind of thing?

data.title: No pdb's generated for Release configuration.
data.body:
See attached image showing the current settings of "Debug Info: none" for the Release configuration.
The request is that this instead be "Debug Info: pdb-only" for Release configurations.

This would actually be a protobuild change, this issue is just for tracking progress towards that, since Protobuild.exe would at least need to be updated within the monogame project after that.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/155688/25156939/95d9aa0c-2463-11e7-9451-e8f153f7a6bb.png)
